title: Queensland Police Seek Suspect in Alleged Robbery Attempt
text:
A man wearing a mask and armed with a large red knife allegedly tried to rob a convenience store in Brisbane, Queensland, on October 21. The apparent botched crime was caught on the store’s security camera, much to the delight of Twitter users.

According to police, a man approached the store in Calamvale, a suburb on the south side of Brisbane, just after midnight and attempted to open the locked sliding glass doors.

As seen in the video, at first he banged on the doors. Then he tried to pry the doors open using his hands and the knife.

After several attempts, he was seen walking from the shop on Algester Road toward Ridgewood Road, police said.

The man is described as Caucasian and between 170 cm and 180 cm (5’7" and 5’11") tall. No one was hurt in the incident.

On the Queensland Police Service’s Twitter feed, online users cracked jokes, including @brett_dunsmore who wrote, “Door: 1, Idiot: 0,” and @oztim88, who wrote, “He is a bit like his knife, not the sharpest.” Credit: Queensland Police via Storyful
